content.text:
A 49-year-old man has had marked chest pain for the last 4 hours. An EKG shows ST segment elevation. Laboratory studies show cardiac troponin of 10 ng/mL. The representative gross appearance of his disease process is depicted here. Which of the following findings is most likely to occur in this man? <image 1> 

A. Liquefactive necrosis
B. Caseous necrosis
C. Coagulative necrosis
D. Wet gangrene

The representative gross appearance of the disease process in the image shows a large, dark, and necrotic area in the center of the heart, which is characteristic of wet gangrene. Wet gangrene is characterized by a necrotic area that is surrounded by a zone of hemorrhage and edema, which is not present in the other options. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Wet gangrene.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
